publicationXreff92.standardName: Pathways and control of ketone body metabolism: on the fringe of lipid biochemistry.

pathway.author: [N.Reyes, MaintBot, Thomas, Khanspers, Ddigles, AlexanderPico, Egonw, Eweitz]

comments.content:
Ketone bodies are three water-soluble compounds that are produced as by-products when fatty acids are broken down for energy in the liver and kidney. They are used as a source of energy in the heart and brain. In the brain, they are a vital source of energy during fasting.

Source: [[wikipedia:Ketone_bodies|Wikipedia]]
This pathway was inferred from Homo sapiens pathway [http://www.wikipathways.org/index.php?title=Pathway:WP311&oldid=21335 WP311(r21335)] with a 55% conversion rate.
